citations.desc: Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers.
citations.narrative:
One Dachshund (dog) was accepted as cargo at San Diego International Airport on April 16, 2025. The dog was
scheduled to be shipped to Seattle, WA (Air Waybill #027-37241971) at 2:15pm on flight 1033.
The shipper’s certification, provided by cargo personnel, was not completed indicating that the dog was offered food and
water approximately 30 minutes prior to delivery to the cargo department, but there were no specific food and water
instructions completed for the required 24-hour period.
At the time of accepting a dog for shipment, the carrier must ensure that the consignor provides certification of the last
time food and water was offered and specific feeding and watering instructions for a 24-hour period. The certification and
feeding and watering instructions are important to ensure an animal being transported is offered food and water with
sufficient frequency to provide for the animal's health and well-being. The certification and feeding instructions should be
clearly displayed on the carrier during transit.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.14(c)(3) 
   
Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers. 
One Dachshund (dog) was accepted as cargo at San Diego International Airport on April 16, 2025. The dog was 
scheduled to be shipped to Seattle, WA (Air Waybill #027-37241971) at 2:15pm on flight 1033. 
 
The shipper’s certification, provided by cargo personnel, was not completed indicating that the dog was offered food and 
water approximately 30 minutes prior to delivery to the cargo department, but there were no specific food and water 
instructions completed for the required 24-hour period. 
 
At the time of accepting a dog for shipment, the carrier must ensure that the consignor provides certification of the last 
time food and water was offered and specific feeding and watering instructions for a 24-hour period. The certification and 
feeding and watering instructions are important to ensure an animal being transported is offered food and water with 
sufficient frequency to provide for the animal's health and well-being. The certification and feeding instructions should be 
clearly displayed on the carrier during transit. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
